name: Zombie Shooter
description: Where is the line between life and death? How far can human science go trying to understand this? Take part in the great battle to rescue humanity and find out what's happening! The human race is in danger again. This time scientists could not cope the imminent threat and became monsters themselves.

reviews.review_text: Very funny, very enjoyable top-down shooter with great controls and atmosphere, and some RPG and weapon-upgrade elements!  Pros gun turrents Upgrade stats and weapons Buy weapons ammo lots of zombies turrent defense mode survival mode  Cons N/A

This is a mindless awesome shoot-a-thon with tons of weapons, upgrades, character leveling, power-ups and alot more. Three game modes (campaign, survival & timed arenas) provide a small diversion from the obvious repetitive nature of gameplay.   Though dont expect anything but graphics that were acceptable in the 80s. There are no achievements & no multiplayer to keep you playing this. However the game does have a certain base charm. If mowing down hordes with a shed load of weapons while never really getting challenged then this is a decent cheap game. Just dont expect anything too much.
Fun time killer, but not worth $14 by any means. Game takes around 2 hours to beat (the same as Alien Shooter) if you see it on sale for $2.50 its a good buy. The gore in the game is incredible.
u shoot zombies in this video game

So, I'd have racked up some more hours on this thing, maybe even completed it, but the game grew sentient and realised my save files were the only thing stopping it from flying free into the wilds of my uninstalled list.  Alas, it wasn't actually too bad. Curiously, far and away the best piece of game design evident was the 'feedback' you got from killing zombies - a pleasant combination of audible and visual 'splatting' that made for rather satisfying gunplay. The variety of weapons and various other utilities was just wide enough to inject the game with that ever-pleasant feeling of progression we all know and love from Call of Duty, so it was a pretty fun distraction to play here, there and everywhere when I had 20 minutes to brutally murder.  A stellar example of a 7/10 game.
Although old, this game is still a lot of fun! If you played Red Nation, then you'll enjoy this.

Is it possible to have too many zombies? I think this game may be pushing the limit! This is an insanely fun and addicting shooter. Your screen will literally turn red from all the zombies you kill. Decent selection of devastating weapons with levelling up features on both your weapons and your character. The graphics are the biggest weakness and the camera angle sucks in certain spots, but the non-stop action keeps you too busy to notice. If this game was co-op, it would be off the hook. Alien Swarm should take some pointers from this game about how to put fun into killing zombies.
Playable; almost as good as Alien Shooter 2. I decided not to finish this one as it was really just aliens redone as zombies - support the indie studios!

A bland, simplistic and repetitive action game in which you, as the player, shoot your way trhough an horde of zombies just because.  It has smallish RPG elements (As you get points to increase stats that affects in the amount of ammo you can carry, how good you aim, etc), you can upgrade your weapons... and nothing more. Its just bang bang bang until you get to the slightly interesting final boss battle and the end. Not to mention the horrible collision detection and the awfuls (even for a Zombie Game) A.I.  Unless you are looking for some brain-dead (pun intended) fun, Zombie Shooter will be a waste of time and (looking at its current price tag) of money. If you are looking for some shooting, maybe this could be your game. Maybe not.  Got to say that I played the sequel some time ago and kinda of enjoyed it, even though it was the same, just a bit better.

For any one thing I might be able to say FOR buying this game I have about 10 that fall in the AGAINST catagory. Buggy hit detection, getting stuck in walls, useless weapons (useless unless you run out of ammo, but you're screwed by that point anyways), uninteresting story, mindless AI (for the things that aren't really zombies in the game they are brainless).
pewpewpewpewpewpewpewpewpewpewpewpewpewpewpewpewpewpew good but could be better. Zombie AI is terrible and you can't see through certain angles.

Do not buy this game. For some people, the game will shut off when you die. Even if you buy med-kits or extra lives, they will not automatically deploy and as soon as your health hits zero, the games shuts off and you have to restart from Steam. This started happening to me after I got to level four, which took me more than two hours, so now Steam won't even give me a refund. I tried to explain that the glitch started happening after two hours into it, and now on levels 1, 2, and 3 when I die the game shuts off, but they did not care. This was a huge waste of money.
it speaks for itself

here's a good fast-paced shooter game. the level design is good as the gameplay is. some minor bugs here and there which don't ruin the experience. great sprite-style graphics and sticky zombie part all over the floor ;)  it's the typical game you can pick up and play for 10 minute at a time when you're bored.

Micro Review by Pixel Hunter (May 8, 2015)  'Zombie Shooter' Overall Score: 6/10  Controls: 7/10 Gameplay: 6/10 Graphics: 6/10 Music/Sound FX: 6/10  Genre: Action RPG Length: 3-5hrs (Story) Purchased Price: 0.99 (Reg: $16.99CAD) Recommended Price: $2.50 or less  Pros:  + Dumb fun, twin stick arcade action + Multiple weapons to buy, find and upgrade + Always love an isometric game + Cool zombie variations/mutations + Always nice to have an infinte ammo weapon as backup  Cons:  - Repetivive - Not a game to play in long sessions - Gets frustrating when large groups of mobs continually spawn in when completing mission objectives - Getting stuck on walls, enemies and invisible objects is frustrating  Neutral:  = Ended up favoring a few weapons, instead of strategizing with them all = More mission varations would have been nice = More the one boss woul d have been nice = Overall easy game  Final Thoughts:  I'll always love isometric games and this game gets me nostaglic for games like the Crusader series and Project: Overkill. Although not something to play in big sessions, its definitly great for bursts of dumb fun, Good to note that this game is on sale quite frequently on Steam and various bundle stores for $1 or less.

This cousin of that awful Alien shooter and Alien shooter revisited is worth playing in my opinion. I am glad the developers remove those endless horde of enemies concept and put some objectives that can actually be achieved. The freaks finally have an end to them, albeit still damn freaking overwhelming. The sound is just as bad as the Alien shooter series and the music is repetitive. Play this if you are bored and just want to kill something, as it provides about 2 to 3 hours of reasonable fun.
Simple but fun thirdperson action shooter with massive amount of gore. Story nonexistent and really short playtime. Rating: 5/10 - definitely worth a buy on sale.

An entertaining, if repetitive top down shooter that's absolutely jam-packed with enemies. Identical to the Alien Shooter games- if you like those, you'll like Zombie Shooter.

Main game is fun and has some powerful upgradable weapons to decimate hordes of zombie walking and running towards you. Good stress relief and doesn't take too long.  Survival mode is quite boring, you always get the same weapons and die at the same time when zombies star shooting at you from all directions. Turret mode is even more meaningless having only two weapons - turret itself and mini-nuke. So I recommend the campaign mode, but don't bother with the other two.
